questions-and-answers.explanation: Everything in Java is associated with classes and objects, along with its attributes and methods. For example: in real life, a car is an object. The car has attributes, such as weight and color, and methods, such as drive and brake.

questions-and-answers.text: An object is an instance of a class
questions-and-answers.explanation: A Java object is a member (also called an instance) of a Java class. Each object has an identity, a behavior and a state.
Object-oriented programming is about creating objects that contain both data and methods.

questions-and-answers.text: The ______ method is the entry point of a program
questions-and-answers.explanation: The Java main method is usually the first method you learn about when you start programming in Java because its the entry point for executing a Java program. The main method can contain code to execute or call other methods, and it can be placed in any class that’s part of a program

questions-and-answers.text: Which of these are features of OOP? Select all that applies.
questions-and-answers.explanation: The answer is all of the above because object-oriented programming has four basic concepts: encapsulation, abstraction, inheritance and polymorphism. While these concepts may seem complex, understanding the general framework of how they work will help you understand the basics of an OOP computer program.
The answer is print a statement because System.out.println() is used to print an argument that is passed to it.
Java is the world's third most popular programming language, after Python and C .

questions-and-answers.text: Which method has no return type?
questions-and-answers.explanation: Any method declared void doesn't return a value.

questions-and-answers.text: ______ is the data type used for integers.
questions-and-answers.explanation: Integer types store whole numbers, positive or negative (such as 123 or -456), without decimals.

questions-and-answers.text: What type of loop is used when you know how many times you want to loop through a block of code?
questions-and-answers.explanation: When you know exactly how many times you want to loop through a block of code, use the for loop instead of a while loop

answers.text: A method that has a return type

questions-and-answers.explanation: A function is a method that does have a return value. To define a method to be a function, set its return type to be the type of the value it is returning.
The Java int keyword is a primitive data type. It is used to declare variables. It can also be used with methods to return integer type values. It can hold a 32-bit signed two's complement integer.

questions-and-answers.text: Which is used for numbers in Java? Double or Char
questions-and-answers.explanation: The double keyword is a data type that can store fractional numbers from 1.7e−308 to 1.7e+308.

questions-and-answers.text: The ________ keyword is used to get a package, class or interface.
questions-and-answers.explanation: import is a Java keyword. It declares a Java class to use in the code below the import statement. Once a Java class is declared, then the class name can be used in the code without specifying the package the class belongs to.

questions-and-answers.text: Which symbol is used to comment out information?
questions-and-answers.explanation: Comments can be used to explain Java code, and to make it more readable. It can also be used to prevent execution when testing alternative code.Single-line comments start with two forward slashes (//).
